summary: Methane, a greenhouse gas, is emitted during oil and gas production—either through intentional releases or leaks. It is also a lost source of revenue for the government when emitted from sources on federal lands. Methane emission rules are now being revised. Some in the oil and gas industry are voluntarily reducing methane emissions, such as by using satellites to detect them, in addition to the...
title: Oil and Gas: Federal Actions Needed to Address Methane Emissions from Oil and Gas Development
